post.summary: re-indexes conversations for all clients. Requires ADMIN permissions

put.summary: set/update the status of the conversation
set/update the status of the conversation

get.description: check if the provided login is already taken

post.description: recover password: either start or complete the password recovery process
create a new user and assign it to the client

put.description: assign an existing user with the client

delete.description: unassign a user from the client

get.summary: retrieve list of the basic configurations

get.description: Lists conversations. Supports pagination (default 10conversation per page)

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: If the authentication (by user or auth-token) allows access to multiple clients this parameter allows to  specify the clients to be considered for processing the request (intersection of assigend to the user and parsed). For processing of some requests only a single client is supported in those cases a `400 BAD_REQUST` response will be triggered in cases where multiple clients are selected

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (NOTE that `0` is the first page - 0-indexed)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of elements on a single page

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description: Not yet implemented! Will allow to select different projections over the returned data

post.description:
Create a new Conversation.

If a `callback` is provided, the request will trigger an callback with analysis results for the parsed conversation soon as those are available. This callback provides the same information as a subsequent call to `GET /conversation/{id}/analysis`.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: Optionally the conversation to create. If not present an empty conversation will be created

parameters.name: analysis
parameters.description: If enabled the analysis of the conversation is included in the response. This requires the request to wait for the analysis to be completed. In case a `callback` is supported and provided the analysis results will be POST to this URI instead. In any case requests supporting is parameter will start analysis and cache the results for improved response times on subsequent `GET /conversation/{id}/analysis` requests.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: URI where to POST the Analysis results as soon as they are available (async processing)

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description: Not yet implemented! Will allow to select different projections over the returned data

get.description: Search for a conversation. Besides simple text-queries, you can pass in arbitrary solr query parameter.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: If the authentication (by user or auth-token) allows access to multiple clients this parameter allows to  specify the clients to be considered for processing the request (intersection of assigend to the user and parsed). For processing of some requests only a single client is supported in those cases a `400 BAD_REQUST` response will be triggered in cases where multiple clients are selected

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: fulltext search

503.description: If conversation search is not supported

get.description:
Search for messages. You can pass in arbitrary solr query parameter (`q` for the query, `fq` for filters, facets, grouping, highligts, ...). Results represent messages. 

 Fields include: 
* `id`: the id of the conversation 
* `message_id`: the id of the message 
* `meta_*`: meta fields set for the conversation ( e.g. `meta_channel_id` for the channel id)
* `user_id`: the id of the user that was sending the message
* `time`: the time when the message was sent
* `message`: the content of the message

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: If the authentication (by user or auth-token) allows access to multiple clients this parameter allows to  specify the clients to be considered for processing the request (intersection of assigend to the user and parsed). For processing of some requests only a single client is supported in those cases a `400 BAD_REQUST` response will be triggered in cases where multiple clients are selected

get.description: Retrieves a conversation based on the `conversationId`. If `analysis` is enabled the analysis results will be included in the response

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: If the authentication (by user or auth-token) allows access to multiple clients this parameter allows to  specify the clients to be considered for processing the request (intersection of assigend to the user and parsed). For processing of some requests only a single client is supported in those cases a `400 BAD_REQUST` response will be triggered in cases where multiple clients are selected

parameters.name: analysis
parameters.description: If enabled the analysis of the conversation is included in the response. This requires the request to wait for the analysis to be completed.

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description: Not yet implemented! Will allow to select different projections over the returned data

400.description: in case `analysis=true` the request requires a single client to bespecified to calculate the analysis for. If the authenticated user is assigend to multiple clients and theparameter `client` is not specified a `400 Bad Request` is triggered

404.description: if no conversation with the parsed id is present or not accessible by the authenticated user
if no conversation with the parsed id is present or not accessible by the authenticated user

get.description:
retrieve the analysis results for a conversation referenced by the `conversationId`. Theanalysis includes extraceted tokens, templates and query suggestions based on those templates.

If a `callback` is provided, the request will return immediatly with `202 Accepted` and the results will be `POST {callback}` as soon as available.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: If the authentication (by user or auth-token) allows access to multiple clients this parameter allows to  specify the clients to be considered for processing the request (intersection of assigend to the user and parsed). For processing of some requests only a single client is supported in those cases a `400 BAD_REQUST` response will be triggered in cases where multiple clients are selected

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: URI where to POST the Analysis results as soon as they are available (async processing)

200.description: the analysis results (if no `callback` uri is provided)

202.description: accepted (no content). The analysis results are POST'ed to the provided `callback`

400.description: Analysis results are client specific. So a single client MUST BE selected by the request. If the authenticated user is assigend to multiple clients and the parameter `client` is not specified a `400 Bad Request` is triggered

404.description: if the conversation is not found or the authenticated user does not have access

post.summary: re-run analysis based on updated tokens/slot-assignments
post.description:
Allows to re-run the extraction of templates and generation of queries based on a parsed analysis. This allows users to remove, reject, confirm or add new Tokens. Those changesare considered when updating templates and generating queries. 

If a `callback` is provided, the request will trigger an callback with analysis results for the parsed conversation soon as those are available. This callback provides the same information as a subsequent call to `GET /conversation/{id}/analysis`.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: If the authentication (by user or auth-token) allows access to multiple clients this parameter allows to  specify the clients to be considered for processing the request (intersection of assigend to the user and parsed). For processing of some requests only a single client is supported in those cases a `400 BAD_REQUST` response will be triggered in cases where multiple clients are selected

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: URI where to POST the Analysis results as soon as they are available (async processing)

200.description: the analysis results (if no `callback` uri is provided)

202.description: accepted (no content). The analysis results are POST'ed to the provided `callback`

400.description: Analysis results are client specific. So a single client MUST BE selected by the request. If the authenticated user is assigend to multiple clients and the parameter `client` is not specified a `400 Bad Request` is triggered

404.description: if the conversation is not found or the authenticated user does not have access

post.description:
this appends the provided message to the conversation. It is the responsibility of the client to ensurethat a messageId passed in is unique. It the client cannot guarantee that, it MUST leave the messageId empty/null.

If a `callback` is provided, the request will trigger an callback with analysis results for the parsed conversation soon as those are available. This callback provides the same information as a subsequent call to `GET /conversation/{id}/analysis`.

put.summary: update/modify a specific filed of the message
put.description:
Sets the property of the Message to the parsed value

Supported fields include <ul> 
* `time`: value must be a Date, long time or an ISO date/time 
* `origin`: value must be an member of the Orign enumeration 
* `content` value must be a String` 
* `private` value is interpreted as boolean` 
* `votes` value must be an integer` 
* `metadata.*` any metadata field 

If a `callback` is provided, the request will trigger an callback with analysis results for the parsed conversation soon as those are available. This callback provides the same information as a subsequent call to `GET /conversation/{id}/analysis`.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: the field to update

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: If the authentication (by user or auth-token) allows access to multiple clients this parameter allows to  specify the clients to be considered for processing the request (intersection of assigend to the user and parsed). For processing of some requests only a single client is supported in those cases a `400 BAD_REQUST` response will be triggered in cases where multiple clients are selected

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the new value

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: URI where to POST the Analysis results as soon as they are available (async processing)

400.description: if the value is not valid for the field

404.description: if the conversation or message was not found

put.description:
Sets a single property in the Conversation to the value parsed in the payload.

Supported fields include:
* `context.contextType`
* `context.domain`
* `context.environment.*` and the shortcut `environment.*`
* `meta.status` with the shortcut `status`
* `meta.*` with the shortcut `*`: however note that `meta.*` is required for field names that would be mapped to other services of the conversation service.

If a `callback` is provided, the request will trigger an callback with analysis results for the parsed conversation soon as those are available. This callback provides the same information as a subsequent call to `GET /conversation/{id}/analysis`.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: the field to update

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: If the authentication (by user or auth-token) allows access to multiple clients this parameter allows to  specify the clients to be considered for processing the request (intersection of assigend to the user and parsed). For processing of some requests only a single client is supported in those cases a `400 BAD_REQUST` response will be triggered in cases where multiple clients are selected

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the new value for the field

parameters.name: analysis
parameters.description: If enabled the analysis of the conversation is included in the response. This requires the request to wait for the analysis to be completed. In case a `callback` is supported and provided the analysis results will be POST to this URI instead. In any case requests supporting is parameter will start analysis and cache the results for improved response times on subsequent `GET /conversation/{id}/analysis` requests.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: URI where to POST the Analysis results as soon as they are available (async processing)

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description: Not yet implemented! Will allow to select different projections over the returned data

Supported fields include:
* `context.contextType`
* `context.domain`
* `context.environment.*` and the shortcut `environment.*`
* `meta.status` with the shortcut `status`
* `meta.*` with the shortcut `*`: however note that `meta.*` is required for field names that would be mapped to other services of the conversation service.

If a `callback` is provided, the request will trigger an callback with analysis results for the parsed conversation soon as those are available. This callback provides the same information as a subsequent call to `GET /conversation/{id}/analysis`.

Analysis.description: The analysis of a conversation based on the configuration of a client

AnalysisContext.description: The analysis context provides information about the section of a channel analysed.

description.example: Dieser Client wird nur fr die Demo verwendet.

name.description: The name of this configuration. MUST BE unique within configurations for the same type.Typically derived from the displayName by removing spaces and none alpha numeric chars

displayName.description: The display name of the component. Used to derive the name by removing spaces and nonealpha numeric chars.

type.description: the type identifies the component to consume this configuration

enabled.description: if this configuration is enabled/disabled. Intended to be used for deactivating a configuration without deleting it.

unbound.description: if true the configuration can not be applied as the component referenced by by the type value is not active.

Component Configuration.description: The configuration for a component. Configurations can haveadditional fields with arbitrary values.

Conversation.description: a conversation, the central entitiy in smarti

ConversationMeta.description: conversation metadata. Supports strings and array of strings as values. Well known keysinclude: 'support_area', 'token', 'channel_id', 'channel', 'tags'

ConversationResult.description:
A conversation with results for the parsed query. 

 Includes information about theconversation (`id`, `lastModified`, `context`, `meta`, `user`) and the `results` defining sectionsin the conversation releated to the query.

votes.description: votes for this message - how often this message was considered helpful

MessageResult.description: Represents a section in the conversation releated to the quiery

Slot.description: A slot of a template (e.g. departure <time> of a travel planing template)

User.description: a user - taking part in a conversation
